description: Alternaria hordeiaustralica is a filamentous fungus species that belongs to the genus Alternaria. It is known to be associated with barley (Hordeum vulgare) plants, particularly in Australia. The species is characterized by its production of dark-colored, septate, and branched hyphae, as well as the formation of distinctive, multi-celled, and oblong-shaped conidia (asexual spores) that are typically produced in long chains. Alternaria hordeiaustralica is considered a plant pathogen, as it can infect and cause disease in barley crops, leading to reduced yields and quality. The species' ability to produce various secondary metabolites, including mycotoxins, has been studied, and it is known to play a role in the food safety and quality concerns associated with barley-based products.
